## AOSI vs AQ-10

When comparing the Autism Observation Scale for Infants (AOSI) and the Autism Quotient (10-item) (AQ-10), researchers often encounter differences in the presentation and context of their items.

## Compare the items in AOSI and AQ-10

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import AOSI and AQ-10 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AOSI into Harmony</a> - compare AOSI with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AQ-10 into Harmony</a> - compare AQ-10 with other instruments


Harmony, specifically designed for social scientists and psychologists, can be a game-changer in this "AOSI vs AQ-10" analysis challenge. Its ability to use natural language processing and generative AI models simplifies the harmonisation process significantly. Harmony streamlines the tedious process of matching items from these two different questionnaires.

The software provides an innovative solution for "AOSI vs AQ-10" by turning the task into a more manageable and efficient process. It is able to give a percentage match between each item in AOSI and AQ-10. Moreover, if researchers have their own instruments for comparison, they can simply drop their PDFs into the Harmony's web interface, expanding the utility of this tool even further.

In tackling the "AOSI vs AQ-10" comparison, Harmony proves to be an invaluable tool. Whether the researchers are handling their own instruments or leveraging Harmony's database, they'll find that this software saves time, minimizes subjectivity, and enables more accurate comparisons. Incorporating Harmony into the research process will undoubtedly elevate the understanding of relationships and insights from these tests.
